cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest, forecast to turn northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast before moving inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm and storm-surge watches from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and portions of Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Saturday into Sunday with a 17% chance of sustained 34-kt winds; gusts mainly 25–35 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat; surge watches confined to east-central Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to the mid-Texas coast this weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the near-shore Gulf could affect pilot transfers and small-craft operations.
